Articles.Content: So my idea is that you have to pay all of your Kerbonauts a salary each month. You would be able to set how much they get paid, but if you pay them too little then they will quit. The higher experience a Kerbal is, the more they have to be paid to avoid them quitting on you.
While it's not a bad idea, I think the fact you can launch a manned rocket almost to space for $1000 suggests that the kerbals are being paid a completely insignificant amount of money
This is great and very realistic idea, for example having 50 kerbals in your program and after 2 years time warp you could have 0 on account
It could get micromanagy is the only problem I would worry about.

It could get micromanagy is the only problem I would worry about.

Yeah that's always a risk with something like this. We could always just say that the Kerbals have so much fun being blasted into space that they don't need/want to be paid for it
